resources.string: Permissions required for saving and managing photos
This device doesn\'t support Camera2 API.
"If you reject permission,you can not use this service\n\nPlease turn on permissions at [Setting] > [Permission]"

A new version of Filters is available. Do you want to update now?
Won\'t be able to recover this filter
Press the arrow to view the filter list.
Click here to modify the value of the currently selected filter.
Press the Plus button to make your own filter!
Click here to rename the filter.
Make a beautiful filter by changing the property values here!
Here you can choose different properties for creating filters.
Don\'t forget to save the filter after you create it!

string-array.name: Questions
string-array.item: Is there length limit for the name of filter.
I want to restore the deleted filter!
None of above answers my question.

string-array.name: Answer
string-array.item: The Original filter is a filter with no effect. You can not delete or modify the source filter.
The name of the filter is limited to a maximum of nine characters. You can not save it with a name composed of blank spaces.
Selection focus works only in the flash off state. If you put flash off, it will work normally.
The pictures are saved in the Pictures / App Name folder by default. You can change the save path in Settings > Storage Path.
Unfortunately, the filter you deleted once can not be recovered.
If you have any questions, or if you have any suggestions, please send us an email via Settings > FeedBack.
